title: What happens when you keep losing at B5 0 LP ?
body: Recently had a very terrible string of luck and lost multiple games at Bronze 5 0 LP. I recently became aware that if your MMR drops below your current division, you start gaining less LP for wins. Can this happen at Bronze 5 division ?

replies.body:
Your MMR will keep dropping, but you can't have rank lower than B5.

But hey, if you drop your MMR really low you can start making fun videos for youtube.

> [{quoted}](name=BigBadBadger,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-03-16T11:23:13.654+0000)
>
> Your MMR will keep dropping, but you can't have rank lower than B5.
> 
> But hey, if you drop your MMR really low you can start making fun videos for youtube.

And what will happen if you drop your MMR to 0?

This happened to one of the highest MMR players several years ago, but that was because someone hacked RIOT and set a few top players' MMR to 0. 

What happens is you get matched up with the absolute worst players in the game. The guy was a good sport about it, and went ahead and streamed his rise from the bottom back to the top, playing whatever he felt like and winning every game in wood 5 except for one as Alistar support.
Well NA B5 might drop to BR Challenger i guess ;P
You seem to really like playing Azir. Please buy {{item:3001}} or {{item:3157}}, I think that might help. Sorry if I come off as intrusive.
or don't play azir in bronze 5.
You shouldn't tell people who they can/can't play, this makes you look like an asshole.

Im not telling who to play, im saying if he cant get out of bronze 5 0lp then he probably isn't ready for champions like azir who have extremely high skill caps. Lets not deny it, if you cant win consistently in bronze 5 then something needs to change. If he isn't winning a lot with azir, maybe he should take a break from him and play someone like Katarina who can stomp matches. Azir is very team fight based, and in gold and below team fights are just a hot mess of scrambling.

> [{quoted}](name=The Dunk God,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-16T13:04:31.115+0000)
>

If he isn't winning a lot with azir, maybe he should take a break from him and play someone like Katarina who can stomp matches. Azir is very team fight based, and in gold and below team fights are just a hot mess of scrambling.

I don't get what you're saying at all. People here like to toss around the words "high skill cap" like that's something scary. You do anything enough times, it becomes second nature. Its not that hard to learn any champion, I don't care how complex they are. If I can't get out of Bronze with Azir, I'm not gonna be able to do it Katarina either. Katarina is not gonna keep my bot lane from feeding 12 kills by 20 minutes. Also, I've seen everything from Yorick, Lulu, AP Malphite to Urgot carry hard in Bronze. Its not about the champion.

> If I can't get out of Bronze with Azir, I'm not gonna be able to do it Katarina either. Katarina is not gonna keep my bot lane from feeding 12 kills by 20 minutes

Katarina is actually the perfect champion to keep your bot lane from feeding, cus if you roam correctly they enemy bot lane wont even be alive half the time.

> I've seen everything from Yorick, Lulu, AP Malphite to Urgot carry hard in Bronze. Its not about the champion.

None of the things you listed are bizarre, your right they are just champions. Despite being one of the strongest junglers, lee sin has a 45% win rate in bronze simply because people don't play him correctly. If it wasn't true, challenger and lcs level players wouldn't mention it all the time to low elo players.

> [{quoted}](name=The Dunk God,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=000400000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-16T16:11:47.227+0000)
>
> None of the things you listed are bizarre...

You don't think Urgot carrying hard is bizarre ?
Not necessarily, especially in low elo. Because he is an unpopular champion some people may not even know how to play against him and feed.

> [{quoted}](name=XelNiya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=00040000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-16T15:36:53.426+0000)

> I don't get what you're saying at all. People here like to toss around the words "high skill cap" like that's something scary. You do anything enough times, it becomes second nature. Its not that hard to learn any champion, I don't care how complex they are. If I can't get out of Bronze with Azir, I'm not gonna be able to do it Katarina either. Katarina is not gonna keep my bot lane from feeding 12 kills by 20 minutes. Also, I've seen everything from Yorick, Lulu, AP Malphite to Urgot carry hard in Bronze. Its not about the champion.

Yorick dunks on scrubs who don't know the champ and then carries. Lulu is extremely obnoxious top lane and can easily get fed, and even elsewhere she's so safe and reliable that she can potentially carry games (not my first choice though). Malphite is a cheese pick that can easily carry bronze games because of his insanely stupid and reliable burst. Urgot is a lane bully who can potentially get fed and carry.

Katarina can go to said feeding bot lane and get double kills easily. 

Play champs that aren't hard to play and not very team reliant to get out of bronze. It's easier.

> [{quoted}](name=Memeglaive Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=000400000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-03-16T21:43:01.513+0000)
>
> Yorick dunks on scrubs who don't know the champ and then carries. Lulu is extremely obnoxious top lane and can easily get fed, and even elsewhere she's so safe and reliable that she can potentially carry games (not my first choice though). Malphite is a cheese pick that can easily carry bronze games because of his insanely stupid and reliable burst. Urgot is a lane bully who can potentially get fed and carry.
> 
> Katarina can go to said feeding bot lane and get double kills easily. 
> 
> Play champs that aren't hard to play and not very team reliant to get out of bronze. It's easier.

Fair enough. I appreciate what you guys are saying but not playing Azir is totally out of the question. If I have to get out of Bronze, its gonna be with Azir or not at all.

And by the way, I mained Akali before. I have over 250K on her and she, like Katarina is traditionally considered a pub stomper and she didn't help me get out of Bronze. I also play other cheesy champions like Irelia, Garen and Yi. I'm telling you, its not about the champions. Funny think is, I have the most success with Azir. I have a winrate above 50% with Azir and I'm currently maintaining that over many games with him, something I can't do with any other champion. You should have seen my ranked stats for Akali last season when I spammed her relentlessly, it was atrocious. I think I was at like a 15% win rate with her or something terrible like that.

Aside from all that, I don't see what the big deal is. I'm Bronze and I'm fine with that. Nothing I can do that will immediately make me Gold. I don't lose sleep over the fact that I'm not talented enough to get out. Losses are frustrating yes, no denying that but over all, I'm having fun and that's good enough for me. Sure, It'll be nice to rise, but if I don't, its no big deal. Some people are more talented than others. Bronze to you might be ez pz but for me its the hardest thing in the world. I have other things I'm really good at, video games may not be among them. Its cool. I just wanna have fun.

> [{quoted}](name=The Dunk God,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-03-16T12:02:59.020+0000)

u get demoted to wood 5

> [{quoted}](name=Ryùuzaki,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2016-03-17T13:50:12.819+0000)
>
> u get demoted to wood 5

Shouldn't that be Wood 1 ?

Each division is associated with certain MMR range which is a number basically between 0 and 3000+

Your MMR changes steadily when you win or lose. You LP reward/penalty is determined by your current MMR

For example let's say platinum one is 1850 to 1950 MMR.

A player that is currently plat 1 with diamond MMR like 2030 will win like 24 LP a game. If he loses the game he'll lose a tiny amount like 13. The MMR itself changes by probably something like 10-25 every game (depending on how "rooted" you are at that level). MMR changes itself feels like it accelerates slightly during win streaks or lose streaks.

If he had plat 2 or 3 mmr though at like 1790 he'd be losing like 20+ LP a game and winning something like 13. And if he lost at 0 LP he'd probably get demoted.

Bronze 5 is a gigantic range at the bottom at the bracket, probably below 900 or 800 MMR. MMR is always being affected. And it determines when your LP gains become favorable to start rising into the next level.

Don't be discouraged though. You don't REALLY have anything to lose.

> 
> Don't be discouraged though. You don't REALLY have anything to lose.

Nice explanation. But what is the reasoning behind a high MMR playing gaining more for stomping relative noobs ? Shouldn't it be the other way around ? High gains for beating someone better than you and high losses for being beaten by someone worse than you ?

**You're matched based on your MMR.**

So if you win a lot in a row or lose a lot in a row what tends to happen is your LP/division lags behind. You end up being that Gold guy in a Plat game. The plat 4 guy with a bunch of plat 2's. Or maybe the gold 5 guy in a silver game. You can bet in a ranked game (excluding premade grouping factors) matchmaking is as best it gets.

If someone looks oughta place in a ranked game it's usually due to premade groups. Or if they've fallen down they're tilted/previously boosted. Or if they're accelerating up the bracket faster than LP gains they're bringing their A-game with some OP self discovery/ they're smurfing/ getting boosted.

**So basically what you see; the LP & League system. It's all a big pretty yet pointless candy wrapper.** It gets to the point but lags; it has latency to insure people don't barely touch the tip of some goal and freak out playing ranked. It attempts to make the achievement feel more meaningful than "2000 MMR"

> [{quoted}](name=Sohleks,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=000f00000000,timestamp=2016-03-17T13:46:34.447+0000)

It attempts to make the achievement feel more meaningful than "2000 MMR"

Oh I get it. It wants to place you at your correct tier/division as quickly as possible based on MMR so it manipulates LP gains and losses to speed up the process. Makes sense.
I would start focusing on what you can do to improve. If you keep losing you will eventually condemn your account to be permanently bronze 5 and you'll be losing 20 lp and winning 3

> [{quoted}](name=lilpokfluf,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-03-16T15:26:19.211+0000)

Well, this is about the 3rd time it happened. I'm not all that concerned. Its just a streak of bad luck that'll break eventually. I made it close to B3 about twice this season and got beaten back down to B5 0 LP. This is the worst streak so far though.
Dear lord man, if you're struggling between B5 and B3 there's a serious problem with your gameplay, something central like being able to cs?

The serious problem with gameplay in B4-B3 is that you most often have literally 4 players on your team.

Lots of afks and intentional feeders.

> [{quoted}](name=Charzin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=o0x3zZk0,comment-id=000900000000,timestamp=2016-03-17T00:38:44.731+0000)

Perhaps. But I'm definitely better today than I was say, 4 months ago, and I'll be better 5 months from now than I am today. I don't expect to find shortcuts.
U get future reddit threads full of ppl saying that they 9-1'd provisionals and got bronze 5. (cause your mmr still decreases even if you can't drop further in the ladder)
You will fall into wood
and eventually cardboard
And then plastic
To eventually be in paper
then we reach Lead, because its too heavy and not very healthy
Then we hit Dirt. In dirt level, everyone just sits there.

...but you can use the dirt to build a house. After that all you have to do is hand chop some wood, find some coal, kill an Enderman, take his pearls, use ender portal, kill Ender Dragon, profit....what are we talking about again?
You sink into the mythical cardboard 33. .  . It's a strange place. Not many cardboard's out there.
you become challenjour in latin america north server

I use many different kinds of builds. Even that one. Except I get {{item:3027}} instead of Seraphs. My reasoning is that it helps get him tanky without sacrificing damage. {{item:3027}} is the only item apart from {{item:3089}} that gives a flat 120 AP, it has to be fully stacked of course. The passive on Catalyst/ROA also acts as a kind of sustain for him in lane. Azir has really really terrible sustain and spellvamp doesn't work well on him at all due to the fact that his main damaging spell is Aoe which cuts spellvamp to a 1/3 of its power.

I'm curious, why do think {{item:3003}}/{{item:3040}} is better on him. I never considered trying that.
